main event: A bright light object was observed on radar and visually at Godman AFB, Kentucky on January 23, 1953.
interesting points: The object appeared stationary on the radar scope but was observed as a bright light visually.
The object was silent and disappeared from the radar scope after 2 minutes.
The witness described the object as a 'large star-like object' that would 'blaze up then dim out' and was not recognized as a common star.
The witness was located in the Godman Tower at Fort Knox, Kentucky and was scanning the skies when the object was spotted.
The witness estimated the object was 15-20 miles away and 35 degrees above the horizon when it was first seen.
